item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, May 1, 2025 at 6:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Mercury: Commercial-scale diffusion language model (279 points | 103 comments)
2. Apple violated antitrust ruling, judge finds (587 points | 199 comments)
3. 108B Pixel Scan of Johannes Vermeer's Girl with a Pearl Earring (105 points | 36 comments)

6. Espressif's ESP32-C5 Is Now in Mass Production (136 points | 89 comments)

9. Xiaomi MiMo Reasoning Model (424 points | 160 comments)

11. I created Perfect Wiki and reached $250k in annual revenue without investors (613 points | 343 comments)

14. Company built its own rail terminal in NYC to avoid relying on trucks (66 points | 12 comments)
15. Reversible computing with mechanical links and pivots (130 points | 59 comments)
16. NotebookLM Audio Overviews are now available in over 50 languages (258 points | 79 comments)

22. Sycophancy in GPT-4o (515 points | 408 comments)
23. Future of OSU Open Source Lab in Jeopardy (205 points | 69 comments)
24. The one interview question that will protect you from North Korean fake workers (56 points | 26 comments)
25. Phi-4 Reasoning Models (96 points | 21 comments)
26. You Wouldn't Download a Hacker News (392 points | 202 comments)
27. Milwaukee police considering trading mugshots for facial recognition tech (85 points | 22 comments)
28. Wyze pays $255k of tariffs on $167k of floodlights (72 points | 25 comments)
29. DeepSeek-Prover-V2 (328 points | 64 comments)
30. Show HN: ART – a new open-source RL framework for training agents (78 points | 9 comments)
